## Requirement - what kind of business use case are you trying to solve?
We use public certificates to secure our gRPC communicates on the Jaeger collector. These are signed by trusted Certificate Authorities, so the expectation is that the agent would trust them by default.  However, these are not trusted today by the Jaeger agent. 
<!-- required section -->

## Problem - what in Jaeger blocks you from solving the requirement?
CA certificates are not loaded into the jaeger-agent container.
<!-- required section -->
<!-- If possible, describe the impact of the problem. -->

## Proposal - what do you suggest to solve the problem or improve the existing situation?
Load the cacerts package from alpine similar to how OpenTelemetry service does it.
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-service/blob/master/cmd/otelsvc/Dockerfile#L5
<!-- It's ok if you don't have one. -->

<!-- Questions that should be answered before proceeding with implementation. -->
title: Jaeger Agent container should trust certificates from public CAs by default
